content.prompt: A Marxist historian arguing against the contention regarding the sans-culottes in the first paragraph would likely cite which of the following as evidence?

choices.label: The sans-culottes’ identity as rooted in their socioeconomic status
The sans-culottes’ involvement in the storming of the Bastille
The sans-culottes’ attacks on the foreign mercenaries employed by Louis XVI
The sans-culottes’ support for a popularly elected democratic government

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
